page.title: 11Fishing on the River Avon
page.content: The fishing on the River Avon, a chalk stream, is privately owned by Mr Angus of Bulford and The Services Dry Fly Fishing Association.Mr Angus and the S.D.F.F.stock the river with trout.Fly fishing is the only technique allowed, predominantly dry fly, but up stream nymphing is allowed at times during the season.The season begins in April when iron blues and olives are the flies used.In May the whole river comes alive with mayfly and this is the best artificial fly.In October the season ends and electro fishing is used to remove predators like pike. If left to its own devices the river would revert to a coarse stream,so weed is cut in April and June. People pay up to Â£300 a season to fish this stretch of the Avon. Poaching, mainly by children is a serious problem.
